page.title: 16Tourism - Winchfield Area
page.content: The{Basingstoke Canal}was opened in the 1790's as a means of transport but since it has been restored it has attracted many tourists to this otherwise quiet corner of Hampshire. The canal was jointly purchased by Surrey & Hampshire County Councils in 1974. The Surrey & Hants Canal Society cleared the towpaths and dredged the canal.The three bridges in this block - namely Boseley's Bridge, Stacey's Bridge & Barley Mow Bridge - built in 1794, have been made safe or rebuilt. During the past year a{public slipway has been opened at Winchfield Wharf. It is regularly used by people from quite a radius to launch their craft. For those who don't own boats{the {'John Pinkerton' narrow-boat makes {regular trips.}The towpath provides {scenic walks & cycle rides}and a pleasant location in which to fish.
